trans-unit.source: The SeriesCollection class represents a collection of <xref:System.Web.UI.DataVisualization.Charting.Series> objects, which in turn represent a grouping of related data points and attributes for the series.

This collection class is implemented as the <xref:System.Web.UI.DataVisualization.Charting.Chart.Series%2A> collection property of the root <xref:System.Web.UI.DataVisualization.Charting.Chart> object.
Series objects can be appended, inserted or removed from the collection at both design time and run time.

When a series is added to the collection, it is automatically assigned to the <xref:System.Web.UI.DataVisualization.Charting.ChartArea> object named "Default" or, if "Default" does not exist, to the first available chart area in the chart area collection.
Adds a <xref href="System.Web.UI.DataVisualization.Charting.Series"></xref> object with the given name to the end of the collection.
Items are always added as the last item in the collection.
The `name` argument refers to the `Name` property of the object being added.

**Note** If you use this method to add <xref:System.Web.UI.DataVisualization.Charting.Series> objects to the <xref:System.Web.UI.DataVisualization.Charting.SeriesCollection> class, the associated <xref:System.Web.UI.DataVisualization.Charting.DataPoint> objects of the newly added <xref:System.Web.UI.DataVisualization.Charting.Series> object cannot have more than one Y-value per data point.

To add a series that can handle multiple Y-values per data point, use the <xref:System.Web.UI.DataVisualization.Charting.SeriesCollection.Add%2A> System.Int32)?qualifyHint=False&autoUpgrade=True definition of this overloaded method.
The name of the <xref href="System.Web.UI.DataVisualization.Charting.Series"></xref> to be added.
The new <xref href="System.Web.UI.DataVisualization.Charting.Series"></xref> object appended to the collection.
